00043   VideoResampler :: VideoResampler()
00044   {
00045     mIHeight = 0;
00046     mIWidth = 0;
00047     mOHeight = 0;
00048     mOWidth = 0;
00049     mIPixelFmt = IPixelFormat::NONE;
00050     mOPixelFmt = IPixelFormat::NONE;
00051     mContext = 0;
00052   }
00053 
00054   VideoResampler :: ~VideoResampler()
00055   {
00056     if (mContext)
00057       sws_freeContext(mContext);
00058     mContext = 0;
00059   }

00097   int32_t
00098   VideoResampler :: resample(IVideoPicture* pOutFrame, IVideoPicture* pInFrame)
00099   {
00100     int32_t retval = -1;
00101     VideoPicture* outFrame = dynamic_cast<VideoPicture*>(pOutFrame);
00102     VideoPicture* inFrame  = dynamic_cast<VideoPicture*>(pInFrame);
00103     try
00104     {
00105       if (!outFrame)
00106         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid output frame");
00107       if (outFrame->getHeight() != mOHeight)
00108         throw std::runtime_error("output frame height does not match expected value");
00109       if (outFrame->getWidth() != mOWidth)
00110         throw std::runtime_error("output frame width does not match expected value");
00111       if (outFrame->getPixelType() != mOPixelFmt)
00112         throw std::runtime_error("output frame pixel format does not match expected value");
00113 
00114       
00115       if (!inFrame)
00116         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid input frame");
00117       
00118       if (inFrame->getHeight() != mIHeight)
00119         throw std::runtime_error("input frame height does not match expected value");
00120       if (inFrame->getWidth() != mIWidth)
00121         throw std::runtime_error("input frame width does not match expected value");
00122       if (inFrame->getPixelType() != mIPixelFmt)
00123         throw std::runtime_error("input frame pixel format does not match expected value");
00124       if (!inFrame->isComplete())
00125         throw std::runtime_error("incoming frame doesn't have complete data");
00126 
00127       // Allocate our output frame.
00128       outFrame->setComplete(false, mOPixelFmt, mOWidth, mOHeight,
00129           inFrame->getPts());
00130       AVFrame *outAVFrame = outFrame->getAVFrame();
00131 
00132       // Get our input frame; since it's complete() we can pass anything
00133       // for the argument
00134       AVFrame *inAVFrame = inFrame->getAVFrame(); 
00135 
00136       /*
00137       VS_LOG_DEBUG("%dx%d(%d:%d)=>%dx%d(%d:%d)",
00138           inFrame->getWidth(), inFrame->getHeight(), inFrame->getPixelType(), inAVFrame->linesize[0],
00139           outFrame->getWidth(), outFrame->getHeight(), outFrame->getPixelType(), outAVFrame->linesize[0]);
00140 
00141       memset(outAVFrame->data[0], 64*3-1, outAVFrame->linesize[0]);
00142       */
00143       // And do the conversion; works around FFmpeg checkin r30306
00144       const uint8_t* srcFrame[4] = {
00145           inAVFrame->data[0],
00146           inAVFrame->data[1],
00147           inAVFrame->data[2],
00148           inAVFrame->data[3],
00149       };
00150       retval = sws_scale(mContext, srcFrame, inAVFrame->linesize, 0,
00151           mIHeight, outAVFrame->data, outAVFrame->linesize);
00152       
00153       // and go home happy.
00154       {
00155         outFrame->setQuality(inFrame->getQuality());
00156         outFrame->setComplete(retval >= 0,mOPixelFmt, mOWidth, mOHeight,
00157             inFrame->getPts());
00158       }
00159     }
00160     catch (std::bad_alloc& e)
00161     {
00162       throw e;
00163     }
00164     catch (std::exception& e)
00165     {
00166       VS_LOG_DEBUG("error: %s", e.what());
00167       retval = -1;
00168     }
00169     return retval;
00170   }
00171   
00172 /*
00173  * The next two methods are to work around a break in backwards compatibility introduced
00174  * in FFmpeg in September 2010
00175  */
00176 static int handle_jpeg(enum PixelFormat *format)
00177 {
00178     switch (*format) {
00179     case PIX_FMT_YUVJ420P: *format = PIX_FMT_YUV420P; return 1;
00180     case PIX_FMT_YUVJ422P: *format = PIX_FMT_YUV422P; return 1;
00181     case PIX_FMT_YUVJ444P: *format = PIX_FMT_YUV444P; return 1;
00182     case PIX_FMT_YUVJ440P: *format = PIX_FMT_YUV440P; return 1;
00183     default:                                          return 0;
00184     }
00185 }
00186 
00187 static SwsContext *xuggleSws_getContext(int srcW, int srcH, enum PixelFormat srcFormat,
00188                            int dstW, int dstH, enum PixelFormat dstFormat, int flags,
00189                            SwsFilter *srcFilter, SwsFilter *dstFilter, const double *param)
00190 {
00191     SwsContext *c;
00192     const int *coeff;
00193     int srcRange=handle_jpeg(&srcFormat);
00194     int dstRange=handle_jpeg(&dstFormat);
00195 
00196     if(!(c=sws_alloc_context()))
00197         return NULL;
00198 
00199     av_set_int(c, "sws_flags", flags);
00200     av_set_int(c, "srcw", srcW);
00201     av_set_int(c, "srch", srcH);
00202     av_set_int(c, "dstw", dstW);
00203     av_set_int(c, "dsth", dstH);
00204     av_set_int(c, "src_range", srcRange);
00205     av_set_int(c, "dst_range", dstRange);
00206     av_set_int(c, "src_format", srcFormat);
00207     av_set_int(c, "dst_format", dstFormat);
00208 
00209     if (param) {
00210         av_set_double(c, "param0", param[0]);
00211         av_set_double(c, "param1", param[1]);
00212     }
00213 
00214     coeff = sws_getCoefficients(SWS_CS_DEFAULT);
00215     sws_setColorspaceDetails(c, coeff, srcRange, coeff /* FIXME*/, dstRange, 0, 1<<16, 1<<16);
00216 
00217     if(sws_init_context(c, srcFilter, dstFilter) < 0){
00218         sws_freeContext(c);
00219         return NULL;
00220     }
00221 
00222     return c;
00223 }
00224   VideoResampler*
00225   VideoResampler :: make(
00226           int32_t outputWidth, int32_t outputHeight,
00227           IPixelFormat::Type outputFmt,
00228           int32_t inputWidth, int32_t inputHeight,
00229           IPixelFormat::Type inputFmt)
00230   {
00231     VideoResampler* retval = 0;
00232     try
00233     {
00234       if (outputWidth <= 0)
00235         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid output width");
00236       if (outputHeight <= 0)
00237         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid output height");
00238       if (outputFmt == IPixelFormat::NONE)
00239         throw std::invalid_argument("cannot set output pixel format to none");
00240       if (inputWidth <= 0)
00241         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid input width");
00242       if (inputHeight <= 0)
00243         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid input height");
00244       if (inputFmt == IPixelFormat::NONE)
00245         throw std::invalid_argument("cannot set input pixel format to none");
00246       
00247       retval = VideoResampler::make();
00248       if (retval)
00249       {
00250         retval->mOHeight = outputHeight;
00251         retval->mOWidth = outputWidth;
00252         retval->mOPixelFmt = outputFmt;
00253 
00254         retval->mIHeight = inputHeight;
00255         retval->mIWidth = inputWidth;
00256         retval->mIPixelFmt = inputFmt;
00257         
00258         int32_t flags = 0;
00259         if (inputWidth < outputWidth)
00260           // We're upscaling
00261           flags = SWS_BICUBIC;
00262         else
00263           // We're downscaling
00264           flags = SWS_AREA;
00265         
00266         retval->mContext = xuggleSws_getContext(
00267             retval->mIWidth, // src width
00268             retval->mIHeight, // src height
00269             (PixelFormat)retval->mIPixelFmt, // src pixel type
00270             retval->mOWidth, // dst width
00271             retval->mOHeight, // dst height
00272             (PixelFormat)retval->mOPixelFmt, // dst pixel type
00273             flags, // Flags
00274             0, // Source Filter
00275             0, // Destination Filter
00276             0 // An array of parameters for filters
00277             );
00278         if (!retval->mContext)
00279           throw std::runtime_error("could not allocate a image rescaler");
00280       }
00281     }
00282     catch (std::bad_alloc& e)
00283     {
00284       VS_REF_RELEASE(retval);
00285     }
00286     catch (std::exception& e)
00287     {
00288       VS_LOG_DEBUG("error: %s", e.what());
00289       VS_REF_RELEASE(retval);
00290     }
00291 
00292     return retval;
00293   }
